page.title: 20Social Concerns(and Credits)
page.content:
An important area of controversy in Sutton Benger is the siting of a new burial ground. The Parish Council is obliged to provide a site as the current churchyard is nearly full. Three possible sites are being investigated, but public opinion seems to be opposed to them all. The main objections are based on the level of the water table; proximity to housing; difficulty of road access; and distances from the Church.
{Credits} This project was undertaken by Class 3 pupils from Sutton Benger School with adult supervision. Headmaster Mr David Powell took the photographs; Parent/ Governor Mr John Hughes conducted the land cover survey; and W.I. President and parent Mrs Kay Taylor edited the text.
